languages.text: Затем хормейстер Вайс вознес молитву Богу-Императору, и жизнь покинула несчастного. Вернувшись на корабль, Вайс с почтением передал Лорд-капитану мрачный трофей — амулет, принадлежавший хормейстеру и снятый с его промороженного тела после смерти.

Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.
languages.original_text: Затем хормейстер Вайс вознес молитву Богу-Императору, и жизнь покинула несчастного. Вернувшись на корабль, Вайс с почтением передал Лорд-капитану мрачный трофей — амулет, принадлежавший хормейстеру и снятый с его промороженного тела после смерти.

traits.locale_text: Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

Then Choirmaster Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's staff, taken out of his maimed hand after his death.

Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

Then Choirmaster Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's staff, taken out of his maimed hand after his death.

Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

languages.text: Después, el maestro Weisz ofreció una plegaria al Dios Emperador y el desdichado hombre falleció. Al volver a la nave, Weisz presentó con todos los respetos un trofeo inquietante a{mf|l| la} Lord Capitán: el amuleto del difunto maestro del Coro, recuperado de su cuerpo congelado tras su muerte.
languages.original_text: Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

traits.locale_text: Después, el maestro Weisz ofreció una plegaria al Dios Emperador y el desdichado hombre falleció. Al volver a la nave, Weisz presentó con todos los respetos un trofeo inquietante a{mf|l| la} Lord Capitán: el amuleto del difunto maestro del Coro, recuperado de su cuerpo congelado tras su muerte.

languages.text: マスター・ワイズが神帝陛下に祈りを捧げると、不幸な男は息を引き取った。船に戻ると、ワイスは神妙な面持ちでロード・キャプテンに鬱々とした戦利品を差し出す。それは亡きクワイアーマスターのアミュレットで、彼の死後に彼の凍った遺体から取り出されたものだ。
languages.original_text: Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

traits.locale_text: マスター・ワイズが神帝陛下に祈りを捧げると、不幸な男は息を引き取った。船に戻ると、ワイスは神妙な面持ちでロード・キャプテンに鬱々とした戦利品を差し出す。それは亡きクワイアーマスターのアミュレットで、彼の死後に彼の凍った遺体から取り出されたものだ。

languages.text: 随后，威茨向神皇献上了祈祷，星站上的唱诗大师也就此殒命。回到船上之后，威茨恭敬地向领主舰长献上了一件严峻的战利品：那是已故的唱诗大师的护身符，是在他离世之后，从他冻成坚冰的尸体上取下来的。
languages.original_text: Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

traits.locale_text: 随后，威茨向神皇献上了祈祷，星站上的唱诗大师也就此殒命。回到船上之后，威茨恭敬地向领主舰长献上了一件严峻的战利品：那是已故的唱诗大师的护身符，是在他离世之后，从他冻成坚冰的尸体上取下来的。

languages.text: Dann betete Meister Weisz zum Gottimperator und der unglückselige Mann hauchte sein Leben aus. Als er auf das Schiff zurückkehrte, überreichte Weisz dem Lord Captain eine düstere Trophäe: das Amulett des verstorbenen Chormeisters, das er dessen erstarrtem Leib abgenommen hatte.
languages.original_text: Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

traits.locale_text: Dann betete Meister Weisz zum Gottimperator und der unglückselige Mann hauchte sein Leben aus. Als er auf das Schiff zurückkehrte, überreichte Weisz dem Lord Captain eine düstere Trophäe: das Amulett des verstorbenen Chormeisters, das er dessen erstarrtem Leib abgenommen hatte.

languages.text: Maître Weisz a alors adressé une prière à l'Empereur-Dieu, et le malheureux a rendu son dernier souffle. De retour sur le vaisseau, Weisz a présenté un sinistre trophée {mf|au seigneur-capitaine|à la seigneure-capitaine} : l'amulette du défunt maître de chœur, arraché à son corps gelé après sa mort.
languages.original_text: Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.

traits.locale_text: Maître Weisz a alors adressé une prière à l'Empereur-Dieu, et le malheureux a rendu son dernier souffle. De retour sur le vaisseau, Weisz a présenté un sinistre trophée {mf|au seigneur-capitaine|à la seigneure-capitaine} : l'amulette du défunt maître de chœur, arraché à son corps gelé après sa mort.

languages.text: Ardından Üstat Weisz, Tanrı İmparator'a dua etti. Talihsiz adam ise nihayetine erdi. Weisz, gemiye dönmesinin ardından Lord Kaptan'a tüm hürmetiyle üzücü bir ganimet sundu: Rahmetli Koro Şefi'nin ölümü ardından donmuş bedeninden alınan uğurluğu.
languages.original_text: Then Master Weisz offered a prayer to the God-Emperor, and the unfortunate man passed away. Upon returning to the ship, Weisz reverently presented the Lord Captain with a grim trophy: the late Choirmaster's amulet, taken from his frozen body after his death.
